content.description: Source: Based on data from the United States Bureau of the Census, Historical Statistics of the United States (1975).
content.question: Which of the following was a response to both immigration in the 1850s and the immigration depicted in the graph?

choices.label: Immigrants were provided social support in settlement houses.
Immigrants were restricted from gaining the right to vote in elections.
Nativists advocated against the continued arrival of immigrants.
Reformers helped immigrants to maintain their traditional cultures.

content.answer: Nativists advocated against the continued arrival of immigrants.

topic.text: 6.9: Responses to Immigration in the Gilded Age

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
